meanings.definition: Relics: objects surviving from an earlier time, especially those of historical or sentimental value.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient reliques from the past civilizations.
meanings.sent2: People visit museums to see reliques from different time periods.
meanings.sent3: The antique shop owner jokingly called the old coins reliques from a lost treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother's jewelry box was a treasure trove of reliques from bygone eras.
meanings.sent5: The reliques in the exhibit brought history to life for the students.

meanings.definition: Relics: remains of a deceased person.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully unearthed the reliques of an ancient king.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, reliques are honored and preserved for generations.
meanings.sent3: The spooky movie featured a haunted house filled with reliques of the past owners.
meanings.sent4: The old cemetery was said to be haunted by the reliques of the long-gone residents.
meanings.sent5: The reliques in the crypt reminded visitors of the fragility of life.
